message.content:
cs.MM, cs.CV, cs.IT, cs.HC, cs.AI. 

The paper deals with video quality assessment, which is a topic that can be approached from various perspectives. Based on the abstract, the paper proposes a JND-based VQA model that takes into account both subject and content variabilities. This suggests that the paper could be relevant to several arXiv CS sub-categories, such as Multimedia (cs.MM), Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition (cs.CV), Information Theory (cs.IT), Human-Computer Interaction (cs.HC), and Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI). Among these, cs.MM and cs.CV seem to be the most likely categories, as they directly relate to video processing and analysis. However, the probabilistic framework and maximum likelihood estimation mentioned in the abstract also suggest a possible connection to cs.IT and cs.AI. Finally, the mention of filtering out unreliable video quality scores could be relevant to cs.HC, as it deals with user-centered design and evaluation.
